name: subway Juju charm
description:
Web-Based IRC Client

Subway is a web-based IRC client with a multi-user backend and a JavaScript-heavy UI. Frontend/backend communication is done with websockets (or best available fallback where not available). The backend supports connection persistence and optional logging when the browser disconnects.
license:
# Overview

This Charm is intended for a simple deployment of a [Subway Web-Based IRC Client](https://github.com/thedjpetersen/subway) Cloud Instance.

# Usage

Deploy Subway Instance

    juju deploy subway

Expose Subway

    juju expose subway

Accessing Subway is as simple as going to:

    http://<your_server_address>:3000

To find out the public address of subway, look for it in the output of the
`juju status` command.  

# About

## Subway

[Subway](https://github.com/thedjpetersen/subway) is a web-based IRC client with a multi-user backend and a JavaScript-heavy UI. Frontend/backend communication is done with websockets (or best available fallback where not available). The backend supports connection persistence and optional logging when the browser disconnects.
readme:
# Overview

This Charm is intended for a simple deployment of a [Subway Web-Based IRC Client](https://github.com/thedjpetersen/subway) Cloud Instance.

# Usage

Deploy Subway Instance

    juju deploy subway

Expose Subway

    juju expose subway

Accessing Subway is as simple as going to:

    http://<your_server_address>:3000

To find out the public address of subway, look for it in the output of the
`juju status` command.  

# About

## Subway

[Subway](https://github.com/thedjpetersen/subway) is a web-based IRC client with a multi-user backend and a JavaScript-heavy UI. Frontend/backend communication is done with websockets (or best available fallback where not available). The backend supports connection persistence and optional logging when the browser disconnects.
